summary: This bill, the Sickle Cell Disease and Other Heritable Blood Disorders Research, Surveillance, Prevention, and Treatment Act of 2025, aims to amend the Public Health Service Act to reauthorize a sickle cell disease prevention and treatment program. It focuses on expanding research, surveillance, prevention, and treatment of sickle cell disease and related complications. The bill updates funding allocations and expresses the sense of Congress that further research is needed to understand and cure heritable blood disorders, including sickle cell disease.
